item.title: Auto LPG could be a game changer in reducing emissions with appropriate fiscal incentives: IAC Director
item.description: Noted for its clean-burning properties, Auto LPG significantly reduces emissions of particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, and carbon dioxide, thereby contributing to improved air quality and reducing the overall carbon footprint of the nation.

item.title: Etched is building an AI chip that only runs one type of model
item.description:
As generative AI touches a growing number of industries, the companies producing chips to run the models are benefitting enormously. Nvidia in particular, which commands an estimated 70% to 95% of the market for AI chips, wields massive influence. Cloud providers from Meta to Microsoft are spending billions of dollars on Nvidia GPUs, wary of […]

item.title: Sift is building a better platform for analyzing hardware telemetry data
item.description:
Less than a year after closing its seed round, software-for-hardware startup Sift announced a $17.5 million Series A led by Google’s venture capital arm GV to scale their platform for analyzing real-time data from hardware systems. The company is developing a platform that provides a single source of truth for telemetry data. Such data is […]

item.title: Gen Z photos app Swipewipe sells to French publisher MWM in its largest acquisition to date
item.description:
The acquisition allows Swipewipe's founder to take some money off the table while also continuing to benefit financially from his work via an ongoing revenue-sharing agreement with MWM.

item.title: TestParty raises $4 million to help automate the coding for accessible websites
item.description:
As of today, nearly all of the world’s most popular website homepages are not compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.

item.title: Ex-Fujitsu engineer tells Post Office inquiry Horizon was ‘working well’
item.description:
Gareth Jenkins, the co-architect of the flawed computer system, claims bugs were ‘well controlled’

A former IT engineer working with the Post Office has claimed that the Horizon accounting system was “in general … working well”, despite the software’s central role in a scandal described as the biggest miscarriage of justice in British history.

Gareth Jenkins, a former senior engineer at the contractor Fujitsu, on Tuesday faced the first of four days of questioning in an inquiry into the scandal.

Continue reading...
